page.title: 07Recreational Areas
page.content: In our survey area there are two football pitches. These pitches are in Tamerton Vale Primary School grounds. They are used during the day by school pupils and in the evenings and weekends by young people who live in the area. On the school playground there are two metal objects, one in the shape of an aeroplane, the other shaped like a ball. These are both for climbing on. Away from the school ground there is an area of grass with a stream running through it. Across Tamerton Foliot there is a large area of woodland owned by the Woodland Trust. This also has a stream where children play.
